conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the system step by step.
The object with mass m is suspended by two strings attached to rings E and F.
Forces acting on the mass are weight (mg) and tension in the strings.
Ring E is in contact with rod OA.
Ring F is in contact with rod OB.
System is in equilibrium, so the sum of forces in both horizontal and vertical directions must be zero.
Vertical component of tension must balance the weight mg.
Horizontal components of tension must balance each other.
Assume tensions in strings attached to E and F are equal due to symmetry.
F1 is the normal force from rod OA on ring E, equal to the component of tension along OA.
F2 is the normal force from rod OB on ring F, equal to the horizontal component balancing the system.
F1 = mg because it balances the weight of the mass vertically.
F2 = mg because the horizontal component must balance the system.
Final answer: F1 = mg and F2 = mg.
